translated: The Dhamma-reversal, the Triad-duka Paṭṭhāna text

original: 10.10. Vedanāttika, Hetuduka🔽Nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto🔽nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ🔽paṭicca nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Nasukhāya
analyzed: na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ  na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sukhāya vedanāya sampayuttam na hetum dhamma  paṭicca na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā na sukhāya
translated: The Section on Feeling, the Cause Duka

original: vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naadukkhamasukhāya vedanāya sampayutto
analyzed: vedanāya sampayuttam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na adukkham asukhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ
translated: With a cause that is not associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling there arises a state that is not associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling and has a cause. With a cause that is not associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling there arises a state that is not associated with pleasant feeling and has a cause. With a cause that is not associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling there arises a state that is not associated with painful feeling and has a cause. With a cause that is not associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling there arises a state that is not associated with neither-painful-nor-pleasant feeling and has a cause. (Abbreviated.)

original: nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā …pe… satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)🔽Nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaṁ nahetuṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nadukkhāya vedanāya sampayutto nahetu dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā … satta. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā pe satta 🔽na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttam na hetum dhammam paṭicca na dukkhāya vedanāya sampayuttaḥ na hetu dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā satta
translated: With a cause that is not associated with painful feeling there arises a state that is not associated with painful feeling and has a cause. (Abbreviated.)
